articles.headline: In a Victory for Modi, India Overhauls Its Tangled Tax System
articles.snippet: The new measure, a victory for Prime Minister Narendra Modi, will replace a thicket of state and federal levies with a single economic zone.
articles.abstract: The new measure, a victory for Prime Minister Narendra Modi, will replace a thicket of state and federal levies with a single economic zone.
articles.lead_paragraph: BANGALORE, India — Lawmakers cleared the way on Wednesday for India to forge a single economic zone from its thicket of overlapping federal and state taxes, the most important economic measure since India opened its markets in 1991.
articles.byline: By Ellen Barry and Hari Kumar

articles.headline: Fueled by Small Donations, Donald Trump Makes Up Major Financial Ground
articles.snippet: The Republican nominee’s new fund-raising numbers suggest he has tapped into the passion of his core supporters and may now have the resources to compete with Hillary Clinton.
articles.abstract: The Republican nominee’s new fund-raising numbers suggest he has tapped into the passion of his core supporters and may now have the resources to compete with Hillary Clinton.
articles.lead_paragraph: Donald J. Trump all but erased his enormous fund-raising disadvantage against Hillary Clinton in the span of just two months, according to figures released by his campaign on Wednesday, converting the passion of his core followers into a flood of small donations on a scale rarely seen in national politics.
articles.byline: By Nicholas Confessore and Nick Corasaniti

articles.headline: Fox News Sexual Harassment Inquiry Is Said to Look at What Others Knew
articles.snippet: Investigators are examining whether other executives failed to report improper behavior by Roger Ailes, the network’s former chairman, people briefed on the inquiry said.
articles.abstract: Investigators are examining whether other executives failed to report improper behavior by Roger Ailes, the network’s former chairman, people briefed on the inquiry said.
articles.lead_paragraph: Investigators looking into sexual harassment accusations against the former Fox News chairman Roger Ailes are also examining whether other executives knew of alleged improper behavior by Mr. Ailes and failed to act on it, people briefed on the inquiry said on Wednesday.
articles.byline: By Jim Rutenberg and Ben Protess

articles.headline: A Tantalizing Offering From a Meal Kit Service: The Box
articles.snippet: The reusable box that FreshRealm created to reduce packaging waste is a selling point of its delivery service — and a product it sells to competitors.
articles.abstract: The reusable box that FreshRealm created to reduce packaging waste is a selling point of its delivery service — and a product it sells to competitors.
articles.lead_paragraph: FreshRealm got its start as a meal kit business, sending customers all the fixings to make, say, chicken quinoa salad with arugula and pistachios, or lemon-Dijon salmon with potatoes and green beans.

articles.headline: A Coup, Terrorists and Inflation, Yet Investors Rush to Turkey
articles.snippet: Desperate for yield, big investors are scooping up stocks and bonds in nations like Turkey and Brazil, ignoring political and economic perils.
articles.abstract: Desperate for yield, big investors are scooping up stocks and bonds in nations like Turkey and Brazil, ignoring political and economic perils.
articles.lead_paragraph: On the face of it, this might not seem the right time to be investing in Turkey.

articles.headline: Snapchat Used to Spook Advertisers. Not Anymore.
articles.snippet: When the company started offering ads, brands were wary of high prices and vanishing content. Then it let football fans drench themselves in virtual Gatorade.
articles.abstract: When the company started offering ads, brands were wary of high prices and vanishing content. Then it let football fans drench themselves in virtual Gatorade.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — When Snapchat’s chief executive, Evan Spiegel, took the stage in June 2015 at a marketing conference in Cannes, France, to champion advertising on the ephemeral messaging service, advertisers were wary.
articles.byline: By Katie Benner and Michael J. de la Merced

articles.headline: College Students Protest, Alumni’s Fondness Fades and Checks Shrink
articles.snippet: A backlash from alumni is an unexpected aftershock of recent campus disruptions, as some colleges have reported a decline in donations and a rise in complaints.
articles.abstract: A backlash from alumni is an unexpected aftershock of recent campus disruptions, as some colleges have reported a decline in donations and a rise in complaints.
articles.lead_paragraph: Scott MacConnell cherishes the memory of his years at Amherst College, where he discovered his future métier as a theatrical designer. But protests on campus over cultural and racial sensitivities last year soured his feelings.

articles.headline: Donald Trump Risks Alienating Military Communities in Swing States
articles.snippet: Interviews with voters showed that many were steadfast in their support of Mr. Trump, but his crude remarks about the armed services clearly present an obstacle.
articles.abstract: Interviews with voters showed that many were steadfast in their support of Mr. Trump, but his crude remarks about the armed services clearly present an obstacle.
articles.lead_paragraph: PORTSMOUTH, N.H. — Donald J. Trump is locked in an explosive feud with Republicans in Washington and has already faced humiliating defections within his own party that have destabilized his campaign on the national level.
articles.byline: By Alexander Burns, Noah Remnick and Nick Corasaniti
